    Projects

    PokéWeather

    In this application we wanted to have a fun way for users to get the current weather and associate that with different pokemon. If the user types in a city location, then the page will display a 5 day weather forecast. Then, if the user selects a day in the forecast, that weather will pull up a list of Pokémon.


    Stack:
    • Materialize
    • PokeAPI
    • OpenWeatherAPI
      VisitSource

    Curiosity Cabinet

    An Interactive show-and-tell application that allows contributors to upload an image and then annotate that image with notes pinned to specific parts of the image being described. Viewers can then explore the collection of uploaded images and read all the annotations attached to each image.


    Stack:
    • Annotorious
    • React
    • MongoDB
      VisitSource

    Snake Clone

    A clone of the classic game 'Snake' used to help me learn basic game mechanics.


    Stack:
    • CSS
    • JavaScript
    • HTML
      VisitSource

    Pong Clone

    A clone of the classic game 'Pong' to help me better understand how to integrate math equations into code.


    Stack:
    • CSS
    • JavaScript
    • HTML
      VisitSource

    Pong Clone

    A clone of the dinosaur game you find on the Chrome browser when you have no internet connection.


    Stack:

    About Me

    I have been lucky enough to see many things in my life, but the events below are the things that have influenced me the most.

      2005

      Traveled internationally for the first time to Europe with my grandparents.

      2009

      Sailed to Newfoundland as a crew member of Maine Maritime Academy's schooner Bowdoin.

      2011

      Studied abroad as part of the Danube Summer Institute to study the inner workings of the European Union.

      2013

      Graduated from Texas A&M University with a BS in Political Science.

      2014

      Moved to Jinzhou, China

      2015

      Received my CELTA (Certificate for Teaching English to Speakers of Others Languages) from Cambridge University.

      2019

      Received the Best Teacher Award for EF English First's West Region.

      2021

      Moved back to the US after 7 years in China.

      2022

      Received a certificate in Full Stack Web Development from the University of Texas at Austin.
